diagnosis was initially used to determine the presence of down s syndrome and other chromosomal abnormalities and for the determination of fetal sex in pregnancies at risk for a number of severe x the goal of this review is to define the past achievements future goals and present limitations of intrauterine diagnosis the first section will deal with the general approaches used in prenatal
